doctors.name: Dr. Park Ji Youn
doctors.clinic: Ozhean Clinic (Bangsar & Bukit Jalil, KL + 5 branches in Seoul)
doctors.notes: Founder of Ozhean clinics. Created trademarked FIT program. Bridge between Korean expertise and Malaysian market. Active presence in Malaysia.

doctors.name: Dr. Chong (Dr. Chong Clinic)
doctors.notes: First aesthetic clinic listed on Bursa Malaysia. 26 outlets in Malaysia. Active Instagram presence with Korean-influenced treatment content.

beauty_influencers.name: Neelofa
beauty_influencers.notes: Malaysia's top beauty influencer. Hijab-wearing. Broad beauty content, not Korean derm-specific. Massive reach potential for partnerships.

beauty_influencers.name: Mira Filzah
beauty_influencers.notes: Top Malaysian celebrity/influencer. K-drama fan. Potential for Korean beauty tourism content but not currently active in this space.

beauty_influencers.name: Hanis Zalikha
beauty_influencers.notes: Multi-platform influencer. Beauty content among broader lifestyle. Not Korean derm-specific.

beauty_influencers.name: Aikah Ika
beauty_influencers.notes: Strong TikTok presence. Beauty and skincare content. Potential for Korean treatment vlogs.

beauty_influencers.name: Soo Beauty
beauty_influencers.notes: Based in PJ. Covers 10-Step Korean Skincare Routine. Audience: young adults and teenagers passionate about K-beauty.

beauty_influencers.name: Chloe Leong
beauty_influencers.notes: Chinese Malaysian beauty influencer. Could be effective for bilingual (English/Chinese) Korean beauty content.

beauty_bloggers.name: My Women Stuff
beauty_bloggers.notes: Established Malaysian beauty blog. Meticulous K-beauty product reviews. English language.

beauty_bloggers.name: GreenStory Blog
beauty_bloggers.notes: Malaysian beauty and lifestyle blog with K-beauty coverage.

beauty_bloggers.name: MissJasJas
beauty_bloggers.notes: Malaysian beauty blogger providing honest assessments of K-beauty products.

korean_creators_targeting_malaysia.name: Korean derm clinics on Xiaohongshu
korean_creators_targeting_malaysia.notes: Dozens of Korean clinics actively market on Xiaohongshu targeting Chinese-speaking markets including Malaysian Chinese. They run content, invest in paid promotion, and invite KOLs for experience posts.

gap_analysis.finding: There is NO dedicated Malaysian influencer specializing in Korean dermatology tourism
gap_analysis.opportunity: First-mover advantage exists for a Malaysian creator who documents Korea derm trips in English/Malay/Chinese
gap_analysis.comparison_to_japan: Japan has Nana (600K followers, 30 Korea trips/year), Mayu (85+ visits, certified consultant), Asuka (Seoul-based real reviews). Malaysia has zero equivalent creators.
gap_analysis.micro_influencer_opportunity: PONGO data shows micro-influencers (10k-50k followers) achieve 60-70% lower cost-per-click than macro-influencers in Malaysia
